page.title: 10THE M25 AND M3
page.content: The main feature of the road communications of this area is the intersection between the M25 and the M3. The M25 is a three lane motorway and this section between Chertsey and Heathrow Airport was opened in 1981 providing direct access to the Airport and another bridge over the River Thames to the north. It is used by Airport workers and Heathrow travellers. During the construction of the M3 in the l970s and the M25, many of the local roads had to be diverted or cut off and there was much local concern about the effect of motorway pollution on the surrounding area, as the routes cut across agricultural land. Chertsey itself, with a small one-way traffic system around the shopping precinct seems to have been saved from major road alterations.
